alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 14 at 4:01PM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southern California, including the following area, western San Bernardino County. * WHEN...Until 530 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 401 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated the main band of heavier rain has moved to the east but additional rain showers are expected through the early evening hours. The risk of minor flooding from the earlier rain continues in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Barstow, Fort Irwin, Daggett, Owl Canyon Campground, Lenwood and Nebo Center. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
